snippet: The university offered a qualified apology for keeping the searches, which refocused attention on Harvard’s largest cheating scandal, secret from most of the employees involved.
abstract: Harvard and its president Drew Gilpin Faust offer qualified apology in first public comments on university's searching of staff members' e-mail accounts and keeping searches secret from most employees involved; episode riled faculty members and refocused attention on Harvard's largest cheating scandal.

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and JESS BIDGOOD

lead_paragraph: The university offered a qualified apology for keeping the searches, which refocused attention on Harvard’s largest cheating scandal, secret from most of the employees involved.

headline.seo: Harvard Offers Explanation for Search of E-Mail Accounts
headline.main: Harvard Explains Why Staff E-Mails Were Searched
